intro: Alsine tetrandra, commonly known as purple sandparsley, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to drought conditions. Its flowers are usually purple or pink, and it produces small, dry fruits called schizocarps. Alsine tetrandra is often found in disturbed areas and is considered a hardy, resilient species.
